intro: Silene duthiei, commonly known as the Duthie's campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Silene duthiei is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in high-altitude meadows. Its botanical significance lies in its adaptation to harsh climates and its role in local ecosystems.
